frontmatter.title: Cloud integration made easy
frontmatter.description: Ballerina excels in linking cloud-based applications and services and seamlessly embraces containers. With its built-in support for Serverless providers like AWS Lambda and Azure Functions, Ballerina enables effortless integration across multiple cloud platforms. Deploying Ballerina applications on major cloud platforms takes mere minutes, making it a powerful tool for efficient cloud-native development and integration.

frontmatter.title: Community-driven development
frontmatter.description: Ballerina is a community-driven open-source project with contributions from developers around the world. This means that developers have access to a rich ecosystem of libraries, tools, and resources that can enhance their automation workflows.

frontmatter.title: Connect with anything
frontmatter.description: Ballerina has pre-built connectors and triggers for different protocols, 3rd party SaaS apps, etc., supporting various protocols, data formats, and authentication mechanisms. Ballerina Central, a globally hosted package management system, enables sharing and discovering packages, including those developed for unique organizational needs.

frontmatter.title: Diagram when you need it, Code when you don't
frontmatter.description: Ballerina diagrams foster creativity and flexibility, enabling developers to visualize and iterate on ideas swiftly. Developers can effortlessly switch to code and leverage the powerful language features of Ballerina while maintaining the benefits of the visual diagram.

frontmatter.title: Powerful EDI integration across industries
frontmatter.description: Unleash the power of Ballerina for seamless EDI integration across industries. From healthcare to retail and manufacturing to logistics, Ballerinas ensures effortless data exchange. Convert EDI formats to Ballerina Records, perform data mapping, and accelerate your integration journey.

frontmatter.title: Effortless hosting
frontmatter.description: Looking for a way to deploy your integration solution with ease? Give WSO2 Choreo a try! It effortlessly handles trivial hosting, any integrations, and even integrations as APIs. Simply write your code, connect your repository to WSO2 Choreo, and let it handle the rest.

frontmatter.title: Free and opensource
frontmatter.description: Ballerina is a free and open-source programming language, making it a more cost-effective option for businesses that want to build custom integrations without any expense.

frontmatter.title: Greater scalability, flexibility, and customization
frontmatter.description: Ballerina is a flexible language that enables developers to create customized integrations and workflows to meet their specific needs. Its scalability and ability to handle complex workflows and large volumes of data make it ideal for businesses requiring automation solutions that can scale with their needs.

greater-scalability-flexibility-and-cust.code:
final trello:Client trello = check new ({
    key: trelloApiKey,
    token: trelloApiToken
});

final twilio:Client twilio = check new ({
    twilioAuth: {
        accountSId: twilioAccountSid,
        authToken: twilioAuthToken
    }
});

service github:IssuesService on new github:Listener() {
    remote function onAssigned(github:IssuesEvent payload) returns error? {
        if payload.issue.assignee?.login != githubUser {
            return;
        }
        string message = string `Github new issue assigned!
        ${"\n"}Title: ${payload.issue.title}${"\n"}URL: ${payload.issue.html_url}${"\n"}`;
        _ = check twilio->sendSms(twilioFrom, twilioTo, message);
        
        trello:Cards card = transform(payload.issue.title, message);
        var _ = check trello->addCards(card);

    }
}

function transform(string title, string message) returns trello:Cards => {
    name: title,
    idList: trelloListId,
    desc: message
};

frontmatter.title: Edit, debug, and run in VSCode
frontmatter.description: Ballerina empowers developers to efficiently build, debug, and test their integrations within the familiar and feature-rich environment of VSCode.
